focus.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to give special attention to one particular person or thing, or to make people do this
focus.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
We need to focus public attention on this issue.
He needs to focus more on his career.
focus.translation[0].definitions[0].note: We focused on two main issues
We focused in two main issues
focus.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to point a camera or telescope at something, and change the controls slightly so that you can see that thing clearly
focus.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She turned the camera and focussed on Martin’s face.
He focused his binoculars on the building opposite.
focus.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if your eyes focus, or if you focus your eyes, you look at something and can see it clearly
focus.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: His eyes were focussed straight ahead.
focus.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if you focus beams of light, you aim them onto a particular place
focus.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to
focus.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The focus of recent research has been on environmental issues.
The focus of interest in the series is what goes on in everyday life.
Another focus of feminist debate has been the film industry.
I shall now turn to the main focus of this essay.
Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
The focus of the conference shifted from population growth to the education of women.
The war in Afghanistan had become the focus of media attention.
focus.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if your focus is on something, that is the thing you are giving most attention to
focus.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Our main focus is on helping people get back into work.
focus.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the clearness of the picture seen through an instrument such as a camera
focus.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: He raised his binoculars and adjusted the focus.
focus.translation[1].note_box[0].section: the main focus
The main focus of our attention will be on providing an efficient service.
the central focus
The film’s central focus is the relationship between the two women.
the primary focus
The economic situation is likely to be the primary focus of the discussion.
become the focus
When you give a talk you become the focus of attention.
provide a focus
The church provided a focus for the community.
change the focus
He changed the focus from general to specific issues.
shift the focus
Opposition MPs accused the prime minister of trying to shift the focus onto other issues.
the focus changes/shifts
The focus of the negotiations shifted to working conditions.
the focus is on something
The focus is now on improving students’ communication skills.
the focus of attention
In this section of the talk the focus of attention will be on statistics.
a focus of interest
Animal behaviour has long been a focus of interest for scientists.
the focus of debate
The strike became the focus of debate in the media.
the focus of concern
The spread of the disease has become the main focus of concern.
a change/shift in focus
Over the years, there has been a change of focus from treatment to prevention.
focus.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: when a company tries to serve particular groups of customers in a market with particular needs, rather than trying to serve the whole market
